greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let {b(n)} be the sequence of perfect powers (A001597); then a(n) = max { b(n)-b(n-1), b(n+1)-b(n) }.
example: The perfect powers are 1, 4, 8, 9, 16, 25, 27, 32, 36, 49, 64, 81, 100, 121, etc. The 7th is 27. This is 2 larger than the 6th (25) and 5 smaller than the 8th (32). So a(7)=5.
results.author: _Neil Fernandez_, Oct 09 2002
